Endnotes is important because sorting out the effects of perceived value-added from the effects of a student's pre-college family income can be extremely difficult. Clotfelter studies alumni giving (2001, 2003) using College and Beyond. Other important studies rely on administrative data from a single institution--for instance, Marr, Mullin, and Siegfried (2005), Holmes (2009), and Meer and Rosen (2012). Because they use administrative data, the latter studies focus on a student's receipt of financial aid, his family connections, and other aspects of his undergraduate experience recorded by the institution.
